result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Funk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs, including DOC Supervision Fees.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
-------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No contact/violent contact with victim.
-------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
-------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony D Funk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony D Funk in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Per ADA Berg, no further negotiations.  offer given and put on the record.  Defendant would like to accept offer.  Court goes over previous attorney waiver and defendant is still waiving his right to an attorney.  Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed.  Court gives defendant warning as to deportation if not a citizen of the US.  Defendant pleads guilty to Counts#1 and #2.  Statement by the defendant.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea, and adjudges defendant guilty.   
Sentence: 
Withheld sentence, 2 years probation
Conditions of probation:
Pay court costs, including DOC supervision fees.
No alcohol.
No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Possess no weapons.
No contact/violent contact with victims.
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent
AODA Assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Provide DNA sample unless previously provided.

Defendant Anthony D Funk in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Speedy trial demanded by defendant. Trial dates set. W/S for probation is offer. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony D Funk
Current: N7644 US HWY 12, Elkhorn, WI 53121   (Effective: 09-13-2022)
Prior: N8111 Rose Terrace, Elkhorn, WI 53121

Defendant Anthony D Funk in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer put on the record. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony D Funk in court. Victim also in court. Defendant is advised f the charges and penalties against him. Court enters not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Offer from DA office will be routed to the defendant. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact

Defendant Anthony D Funk in court. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Statement by the victim requesting no contact to be lifted. Court provides info sheet re: how to request that formally. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF693 & 22CM49

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.F. OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Anthony D Funk in court, in custody by video. James Sempf for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. State needs time to make charging decision. Motion to modify bond by defendant. Argument, granted. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.F. OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
